item.title: Opinion | Iran’s Nuclear Pursuit and the Pakistani Example
item.description: India is living with the consequences of failing to stop Islamabad from building a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Sadanand Dhume

item.title: Israeli Strikes Shake Foundation of Iran’s Theocratic Rule
item.description: Iran’s embattled leaders have found themselves in an existential struggle domestically to protect nearly a half-century of rule.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Rheinmetall, Anduril Team Up to Jointly Produce Defense Systems for Europe
item.description: The systems will be jointly developed and produced by the two companies, with suppliers and industrial partners throughout Europe as the continent seeks to ramp up security spending.
item.dc:creator: Adrià Calatayud

item.title: Israel Is Running Low on Defensive Interceptors, Official Says
item.description: A shortage of Arrow interceptors has set off a scramble to augment Israel’s defenses.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Iranian Exiles Watch Israel’s Attacks With Joy Tainted by Fear
item.description: In Germany, many expatriates welcomed signs the Islamic regime is weakening but doubted Israel’s motives and feared for relatives back home.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Zelensky’s G-7 Visit Is Overshadowed by Trump’s Exit
item.description: World leaders had hoped to secure U.S. backing for tougher sanctions on Russia, which struck Ukraine with missiles and drones overnight.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Trump Calls for Iran to ‘Surrender’ as He Weighs Military Action
item.description: The U.S. won’t kill Iran’s Khamenei “at least for now,” the president said, as confrontation over the nuclear program escalates.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: This ‘Bunker Buster’ U.S. Bomb Could Cripple Iran’s Nuclear Ambitions
item.description: The 30,000-pound Massive Ordnance Penetrator is considered by analysts to be the best shot at getting through to targets buried deep under mountains.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dowell

item.title: Live Q&A: Ask Us Your Questions About the Iran-Israel Conflict
item.description: WSJ subscribers can submit their questions to our reporters in the comments space.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Opinion | Iran Is Trump’s Deterrence Moment
item.description: The President can reverse Biden’s Afghan legacy by helping Israel eliminate Tehran’s nuclear threat.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | A New Hope for Middle Eastern Studies
item.description: Pepperdine and the Washington Institute try to salvage the field.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Trump Can Launch the Aukus Security Agreement to the Stars
item.description: No American president since JFK has shown more commitment to space, and the alliance needs to be looking to new theaters.
item.dc:creator: Scott Morrison

item.title: Opinion | Will the U.S. Help Israel Eliminate Iran’s Nuclear Threat?
item.description: Paul Gigot speaks with Foundation for Defense of Democracies CEO Mark Dubowitz on this episode of the Potomac Watch podcast.

item.title: Opinion | My 2001 Hit Song, ‘Superman,’ Is for the Hostages in Gaza
item.description: It became an anthem for the heroes of 9/11. Sadly, America lost that unity after Oct. 7.
item.dc:creator: John Ondrasik

item.title: Canada Considers ‘Buy Canadian’ Policy for Steel, Aluminum
item.description: Canadian officials are considering requirements that would compel government-funded infrastructure projects and defense-procurement agreements to use domestically made steel and aluminum, according to Industry Minister Melanie Joly.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: With Israel’s Major Airport Shut Down, Citizens and Tourists Scramble to Get Home
item.description: It is the first time in Israel’s 76-year history that its main international airport has been closed without any timeline for reopening.
item.dc:creator: Zvi Smith

item.title: Israel Built Its Case for War With Iran on New Intelligence. The U.S. Didn’t Buy It.
item.description: The gap between Israel’s assessment of Iran’s nuclear program and that of the U.S. helps explain why the two allies haven’t been aligned in recent days on dealing with Tehran.
item.dc:creator: Dustin Volz

item.title: Europe Backs Israel Against Iran Despite Anger Over Gaza
item.description: No European government wants to see a nuclear-armed regime in Tehran—but leaders’ support for Israel has limits.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Where Israel Struck Iran’s Nuclear Program: A Visual Breakdown
item.description: A look at the sites that took a hit from the recent attack.
item.dc:creator: Emma Brown

item.title: EU Lays Out Plan to Bolster Defense Industry
item.description: The European Union wants to ramp up defense capabilities by loosening its knot of regulations covering everything from sustainable finance to merger enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Oil Tankers Collide Near U.A.E. as Israel-Iran Conflict Disrupts Shipping
item.description: Shipowner Frontline said the incident near the Strait of Hormuz was due to navigational issues and not related to the current Israel-Iran conflict.
item.dc:creator: Costas Paris

item.title: EU Proposes Ban on Russian Oil, Gas Imports by End 2027
item.description: Russian gas accounted for about 19% of EU imports last year, down from roughly 45% before Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine and oil imports have declined to 3% from 27% in early 2022.
item.dc:creator: Giulia Petroni

item.title: Russia Is Churning Out Attack Drones. Ukraine Is Feeling the Impact.
item.description: Moscow’s drone strikes have grown exponentially thanks in part to a deal with Iran to produce its Shahed drones on Russian soil. An attack overnight that focused on Kyiv killed at least 15.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Trump Leaves G-7 Summit Early Over Growing Tensions in Middle East
item.description: The president didn’t reach new trade deals but signed onto a joint statement calling for “peace and stability.”
item.dc:creator: Brian Schwartz

item.title: Iran Looks to Trump and Nuclear Talks as Escape Hatch as Attacks Intensify
item.description: Tehran faces the prospect of having to submit to a tougher negotiation on its nuclear program as its only way out of its confrontation with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Companies Warned On Iranian Cyberattacks
item.description: Conflict with Israel could catch companies in the digital crossfire.
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Chernova

item.title: A Battered Iran Signals It Wants to De-Escalate Hostilities With Israel and Negotiate
item.description: Messages passed by Tehran through intermediaries seek a return to talks if the U.S. stays out of the fight.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Israel Takes Control of Iran’s Skies—a Feat That Still Eludes Russia in Ukraine
item.description: The power mismatch in the Israel-Iran war shows the importance of air superiority.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: An Island With Strong Ties to Europe Counts Its Dead After Air India Crash
item.description: The only survivor of Air India Flight 171 was born on a tropical island dotted with palm trees and fishing boats. So were 14 passengers who died in the crash.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Violeta Chamorro, Who Led Nicaragua’s End to Cold-War Era Civil War, Dies at 95
item.description: Latin America’s first elected female president won a surprise victory over Sandinista leader Daniel Ortega and demobilized army troops.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Canada Is Gathering Global Leaders in a Province That Wants Out of the Country
item.description: Alberta’s secessionists are gaining ground, contesting Prime Minister Carney’s desire to project national unity.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Israel’s Attacks Leave Iran’s Supreme Leader Exposed—With No Good Options
item.description: Tehran’s bruising fight with Israel has left its military weakened and unable to respond in kind to Israeli attacks.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Kim Jong Un Claims His Capsized Warship Is Fixed
item.description: The destroyer, which capsized last month during a launch ceremony, didn’t leave the shipyard’s dry dock, leaving doubts over whether it is operational.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Air India Boeing Crash Kills Hundreds, Leaves Sole Survivor
item.description: The Boeing jet carrying 242 people crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. Only one person survived the crash, the first fatal incident for Boeing’s Dreamliner aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Anne Merriman, Who Brought Hospice Care to Africa, Dies at 90
item.description: Known in Africa as “the mother of palliative care,” she established a model for pain management and end-of-life care.
item.dc:creator: Jon Mooallem

item.title: Carney Says Trump Meeting at G-7 Summit to Determine Fate of U.S.-Canada Tariff Deal
item.description: The Canadian prime minister said officials in Ottawa and Washington are in intense talks on a new economic-and-security pact, but there is no deal yet.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Loudspeakers Go Quiet on Korean Border, Ending a Year of Audio Aggression
item.description: For a year or so, the two countries engaged in daily standoffs—the North pumping out animal wails and the South blaring boy-band music and news.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Chinese Jets Tail Japanese Air Patrol in Close Encounter
item.description: Japan disclosed new details about China’s unprecedented show of force close to the U.S. partner’s shores over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: China Puts Six-Month Limit on Its Ease of Rare-Earth Export Licenses
item.description: A tentative deal reached in London gives Beijing continued leverage in trade negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Says Breakthrough Possible in Bilateral Talks at G-7 Summit
item.description: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Pete Hoekstra said that all indications point to the possibility of a good economic-and-security deal for both the U.S. and Canada.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Scores Killed in Heavy Flooding in South Africa
item.description: Torrential rain, severe winds and landslides have killed at least 49 people in the poverty-stricken Eastern Cape province of South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: China’s Lock on Rare Earths Dictated Path Toward Trade Truce
item.description: Control of minerals used in electronics has given Beijing powerful leverage in trade negotiations with the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Tanzania’s First Female Leader Championed Human Rights. Now She’s Turning to Repression.
item.description: Critics of Samia Suluhu Hassan say she is clinging to power by locking up and torturing those who stand in her way.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Kimeu

item.title: Russia’s Top Peace Negotiator Is Historian Who Justified the War
item.description: Vladimir Medinsky warned, in an interview, that Ukraine would lose more territory if it doesn’t agree to Moscow’s demands.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: 10 Dead in Rare Austria School Shooting
item.description: The suspected attacker was a 21-year-old Austrian man and a former student at the school, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: ‘Those Who Should Be Seized Should Be Seized’ Review: A People Persecuted
item.description: Beijing at first denied the existence of camps for Xinjiang’s Muslims. Now the party calls them “vocational education and training centers.”

item.title: EU Proposes Nord Stream Ban, Cutting Oil Price Cap to Hit Russia
item.description: The European Union’s executive arm proposed banning transactions with Russia’s Nord Stream gas pipelines and cutting the price cap on Russian oil as part of its latest round of sanctions against the Kremlin.
item.dc:creator: Giulia Petroni

item.title: China Extends Probe Into EU Pork Imports
item.description: China said it would extend a yearlong probe into pork imports from the European Union, as Beijing seeks to bolster ties with the 27-member bloc amid heightened trade tensions with the U.S.

item.title: Xi Tightens Leash on Officials’ Boozing and Lavish Living
item.description: The Chinese leader has revised frugality rules for party and state workers in a bid to extend his authority and save money.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Taiwan Tries to Purge Its Ranks of China Sympathizers
item.description: The government is stepping up scrutiny of members of the civil service and military for signs of misplaced allegiances.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: Ukraine Says It Destroyed Dozens of Warplanes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The clandestine drone attack deals the biggest blow of the war against Moscow’s long-range bomber fleet.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Putin Has Retooled Russia’s Economy to Focus Only on War
item.description: Moscow has expanded military recruitment and boosted weapons production. Peace could jeopardize the resulting economic gains.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Trump Says Putin Is ‘Playing With Fire’
item.description: The president has indicated he is weighing additional sanctions on Russia, potentially as soon as this week.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: South African Leader Pushes Back on Trump’s ‘Genocide’ Claims in Tense Meeting
item.description: Cyril Ramaphosa is visiting the White House after relations with the U.S. deteriorated over race, Israel and trade.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Rebels in Captured City Force Residents to Clean Sewers and Morgues at Gunpoint
item.description: M23 insurgents backed by Rwanda are wielding their new authority harshly after taking over a city in eastern Congo.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: British Police Investigate Fires at Properties Linked to Prime Minister
item.description: British counterterrorism police are probing a string of suspected arson attacks on two properties linked to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Plans to Tighten Rules After Record Influx of Migrants
item.description: Britain’s government said a record influx of foreigners since Brexit had done little to energize the economy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Who Joined Putin in Moscow to Celebrate Victory Day
item.description: More than 20 world leaders gathered in Red Square to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Men Found Guilty of Felling Famous Tree in ‘Moronic Mission’ That Gripped U.K.
item.description: The pair’s destruction of the beloved Sycamore Gap tree stoked nationwide anger and a criminal investigation.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: BOE Set For Modest Rate Cuts As Inflation Stays High, NIESR Says
item.description: Inflation is likely to remain stubbornly high this year, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research said as it cut is 2025 growth forecast for the U.K.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: ‘Trump With a Pint’: How Nigel Farage Is Upending British Politics
item.description: The populist politician’s Reform UK party is soaring in the polls—and doing better at the ballot box—as voters lose patience with slow economic growth and high immigration.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
